Key Match Events: Sunil Chhetri played his last match for India against Kuwait, ending in a 0-0 draw.
Chhetri's best chance in the 55th minute was intercepted by the Kuwait keeper.
Post-Match Reflections: Thousands cheered a tearful Sunil Chhetri off the pitch after his last match.
Chhetri waved to crowds and pressed his palms together in thanks as he departed the field.
He walked through an honour guard formed by his teammates to see him off the pitch.
India's coach Igor Stimac praised Chhetri as an inspiration to everyone and absolutely committed to the Indian jersey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nearly 59,000 fans attended the match in Kolkata.
Fans flocked to the stadium hours before gates opened to chant, sound bullhorns, and dance in the baking afternoon heat.
Banners in the stands showed support for Chhetri, including one that read 'Referee don’t blow the whistle, otherwise Sunil Chhetri will leave us.'
Others: Sunil Chhetri scored 94 goals for India over a career spanning nearly two decades, placing him among the world’s all-time leading scorers.
